channel.title: Sad Plot on It works
channel.description: Recent content in Sad Plot on It works

item.title: Star Wars Baby Names Sad Plot 2.0
item.description: 1) Clean Reproducible Code for Sad Plot 2.0 knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) library(babynames) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(tidyverse) library(ggthemes) library(plotly) library(RColorBrewer) star_wars <- babynames %>% filter(name == "Leah" | name == "Leia" | name == "Padme") %>% filter(year >= 1970) %>% filter(sex == "F") boy_names <- babynames %>% filter(name == "Luke" | name == "Anakin" | name == "Han") %>% filter(year >= 1970) %>% filter(sex == "M") plot <- ggplot(star_wars, aes(x = year, y = prop, group = name, sex, color = name)) + geom_line(size = 1) + geom_line(data=boy_names, size = 1) + geom_vline(xintercept = 1977, linetype="dashed", color = "gray70", size=.

item.title: Waco Home Prices Sad Plot 2.0
item.description: 1) Clean Reproducible Code knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(tidyverse) library(ggthemes) library(plotly) library(RColorBrewer) waco <- txhousing %>% filter(city == "Waco", year >= 2004) %>% group_by(year) %>% mutate(median_waco = median(median), gt_median = median >= median_waco) waco_homes <- ggplot(waco, aes(x = year, y = median, color = gt_median)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.7) + labs(title = "Waco, TX median Sale Price Over Time", subtitle = "Note, the show Fixer Upper debuted in 2013", caption = "Source: ggplot2 txhousing data") + xlab("Year") + ylab("Median sale price by month") + scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2004, 2015, by = 2)) + scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(90000, 175000, by = 10000)) + scale_color_discrete(name="Yearly Median Home Prices", breaks=c("FALSE", "TRUE"), labels=c("Below Median", "Above Median")) waco_homes + theme_minimal() 2) What Type of Graph?
